summary: Build a subscriber login page where subscribers sign in using a phone number, with validation/hint enforcing a 10-digit number starting with 09.

existing_features.title: Create a new Subscriber Login UI that lets an authenticated user claim/sign-in to a subscriber account by entering a phone number (exactly 10 digits, must start with "09"), showing an input hint like "09xxxxxxxx" and blocking submission until the input is valid.

Integrate the subscriber login/claim flow into the existing authentication/profile flow: when a user is authenticated but has no saved profile, provide a path to the new Subscriber Login screen; on successful claim, save the caller user profile with the entered phone number and a reasonable display name derived from the claimed subscriber (or a fallback if not available).

Apply a consistent, distinctive visual theme for the new Subscriber Login screen that fits the app domain and existing RTL styling, avoiding a blue/purple-dominant palette; keep typography and spacing consistent with existing shadcn + Tailwind components.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create subscriber login page using phone number (10 digits) with input hint/validation (e.g., starts with 09)

Add backend support for subscriber login/claim by phone number embedded in the subscriber full name: implement a method that, given a phone number, finds an active subscriber whose `fullName` contains that phone number, and then (a) assigns that phone number to the subscriber record if it currently has a placeholder phone, (b) updates `phoneToSubscriberId` accordingly, and (c) returns a clear success/error result for the frontend.

projectName: Add subscriber phone-number login (10 digits starting with 09) with hint and validation
